reasoning: Deuteranomaly is a genetic X-linked condition causing reduced sensitivity to green wavelengths. Reported as prevalence (not incidence) since it is a lifelong hereditary trait. Estimated ~1% of males and ~0.03% of females globally. Used epidemiological studies of color vision deficiency prevalence.
source: Sharpe LT et al. (1999). Opsin genes, cone photopigments, color vision, and colorblindness. In: Wandell BA (ed). Vision and Visual Perception. Washington DC: National Academies Press.
